alert.note: Alert for Graham; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 14 at 3:04AM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Dangerous to Extremely Dangerous fire weather conditions on Wednesday... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 015 AND 016... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * Affected Area...In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 015 Sheridan and Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham. * Winds...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph in the mid morning to very early afternoon hours, shifting to the west and northwest with gusts up to 60 mph from mid afternoon through sunset as a cold front moves through. * Relative Humidity...As low as 14 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. Any fires that do develop will quickly become out of control. First responders will need to be mindful of the timing of the expected abrupt wind shift when fighting any fires. Blowing dust is also expected and visibilities could be very low. First responders may be impacted.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
